content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Louisiana Oil Spill Coordinator's Office</origin> <pubdate>1999</pubdate> <title>Navigated Waterways of Louisiana, Geographic NAD83, LOSCO (1999) [navigated_waterways_LOSCO_1999]</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <onlink>http://lagic.lsu.edu/data/losco/navigated_waterways_LOSCO_1999.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This is a line dataset of navigated waterways fitting the LOSCO definition: it has been traveled by vessels transporting 10,000 gallons of oil or fuel as determined by extensive research conducted by LSU Department of Geography & Anthropology.  All waterways south of the Gulf Intracoastal Waterway are assumed to be navigated as are all waterways within the Atchafalaya Basin so they were not digitized, and they are not part of this dataset. The line strings of this data set were created by heads-up digitizing following center lines of channels on the LOSCO Thematic Mapper mosaic.  The lines are attributed with the length of stream segments and names. The names of the navigated waterways were researched from maps and local knowledge.</abstract> <purpose> This dataset is a guide to waterways with opportunity for major oil spill due to shipping traffic.  These data are not suited to define the actual centerline of waterways for navigation.  This data set in Geographic coordinates, NAD83 is a reference data set for the Louisiana Oil Spill Coordinator's Office (LOSCO). </purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>1991</begdate> <enddate>1999</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>Range of dates of source imagery and name research</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Unknown</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-93.738075</westbc> <eastbc>-89.414314</eastbc> <northbc>33.008198</northbc> <southbc>29.534592</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>none</themekt> <themekey>waterways</themekey> <themekey>navigated waterways</themekey> <themekey>Transportation</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>none</placekt> <placekey>Louisiana</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>none</accconst> <useconst> These unaltered data may not be redistributed without all of the elements of the metadata listed in the  Supplemental_Information section of this metadata document.  It is recommended that third parties wishing to use these data obtain them from the Distributor listed in this metadata document.  If these data are altered or incorporated into another dataset, they are not to be redistributed without also: altering the name of the dataset, including a Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata (FGDC-STD-001-1998) compliant metadata file that describes the dataset and reflects the alteration steps that makes the new dataset different from this one, and citing this dataset in the metadata as a source for the altered dataset using the source citation specified below.  If these digital data are used in the production of a report or in the compilation of a standalone printed map, then this dataset is to be cited in the report or on the map using the source citation specified below.  The following source citation is to be used when citing this dataset: LOSCO Environmental Baseline Inventory Dataset 'Navigated Waterways of Louisiana, Geographic NAD83, LOSCO (1999) [navigated_waterways_LOSCO_1999]' Users hereby agree to abide by the use and reproduction conditions specified above.  By using the data described in these metadata, the user acknowledges that the terms and conditions of use have been read and that the user is bound by these criteria. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Louisiana Oil Spill Coordinator's Office</cntorg> <cntper>David Gisclair</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Technical Assistance Program (TAP) Director</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype> <address>Louisiana Oil Spill Coordinator's Office</address> <address>Office of the Governor</address> <address>150 Third Street, Suite 405</address> <city>Baton Rouge</city> <state>LA</state> <postal>70801</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(225) 219-5800</cntvoice> <cntfax>(225) 219-5802</cntfax> <cntemail><URL:mailto:david.gisclair@la.gov></cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen><URL: navigated_waterways_LOSCO_1999.gif></browsen> <browset>GIF</browset> </browse> <datacred>Researchers: Brett Territo, Don Davis, Hampton Peele, Rob Cunningham</datacred> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.0.1324</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic> All waterways named fall within the boundaries of the state of Louisiana. Names of line segments were verified. </logic> <complete> This does not include waterways south of the Gulf Intracoastal Waterway or any waterways within Atchafalaya Basin because they are all assumed to be navigated. </complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar> Line positions probably accurate to 50-60 feet based on scale of source material. </horizpar> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>Louisiana Oil Spill Coordinator's Office</origin> <pubdate>1998</pubdate> <title>Thematic Mapper Image of Louisiana, UTM15 NAD83, LOSCO (1998)</title> </citeinfo> </srccite> <typesrc>computer file</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>19921129</begdate> <enddate>19930307</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <srccurr>range of dates of source imagery</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>TM83</srccitea> <srccontr>spatial reference for on-screen digitizing</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc> Vector line segments were digitized in MicroStation using TM83 as a reference. The resultant was cleaned, translated to Arc/Info, and topology was built. The dataset was projected to geographic coordinates NAD83 and exported to ArcView. </procdesc> <procdate>19980000</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Department of Geography and Anthropology, Louisiana State University</cntorg> <cntper>Hampton Peele</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing</addrtype> <address>Louisiana State University</address> <city>Baton The user should refer to the accompanying metadata notes for a description of the data and data development procedures.
